1.brief: a burden; specifically, tribute, or (abstractly) porterage; figuratively, an utterance, chiefly adoom, especially singing; mental, desire
a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
the south (from its drought); specifically, the Negeb or southern district of Judah, occasionally, Egypt (as south to Palestine)
properly, to slide by, i.e. (by implication) to hasten away, pass on, spring up, pierce or change
a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten

2.brief: a look; hence (figuratively) striking appearance, revelation, or (by implication) compact

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
to cover (with a garment); figuratively, to act covertly; by implication, to pillage
to cover (with a garment); figuratively, to act covertly; by implication, to pillage
properly, to be burly, i.e. (figuratively) powerful (passively, impregnable); by implication, to ravage
properly, to be burly, i.e. (figuratively) powerful (passively, impregnable); by implication, to ravage
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
Elam, a son of Shem and his descendants, with their country; also of six Israelites
to cramp, i.e. confine (in many applications, literally and figuratively, formative or hostile)
Madai, a country of central Asia
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to repose, i.e. desist from exertion; used in many implied relations (causative, figurative or specific)

3.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
properly, the waist or small of the back; only in plural the loins
a hinge (as pressed in turning); also a throe (as a phys. or mental pressure); also a herald or erranddoer (as constrained by the principal)
to seize (often with the accessory idea of holding in possession)
a hinge (as pressed in turning); also a throe (as a phys. or mental pressure); also a herald or erranddoer (as constrained by the principal)
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
to tremble inwardly (or palpitate), i.e. (figuratively) be (causative, make) (suddenly) alarmed or agitated; by implication to hasten anxiously
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

4.brief: to vacillate, i.e. reel or stray (literally or figuratively); also causative of both
the heart (as the most interior organ);
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, a breeze, i.e. (by implication) dusk (when the evening breeze prevails)
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)

5.brief: to set in a row, i.e. arrange, put in order (in a very wide variety of applications)
a table (as spread out); by implication, a meal
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
a head person (of any rank or class)
to rub with oil, i.e. to anoint; by implication, to consecrate; also to paint
a shield (i.e. the small one or buckler); figuratively, a protector; also the scaly hide of the crocodile

6.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
near, with or among; often in general, to
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
properly, to lean forward, i.e. to peer into the distance; by implication, to observe, await
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise

7.brief: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
a vehicle; by implication, a team; by extension, cavalry; by analogy a rider, i.e. the upper millstone
hence, an acre (i.e. day's task for a yoke of cattle to plough)
a steed (as stretched out to a vehicle, not single nor for mounting ); also (by implication) a driver (in a chariot), i.e. (collectively) cavalry
a vehicle; by implication, a team; by extension, cavalry; by analogy a rider, i.e. the upper millstone
a male ass (from its dun red)
a vehicle; by implication, a team; by extension, cavalry; by analogy a rider, i.e. the upper millstone
to prick up the ears, i.e. hearken
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)

8.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
properly, continuance (as indefinite extension); but used only (attributively as adjective) constant (or adverbially, constantly); ellipt. the regular (daily) sacrifice
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
watch, i.e. the act (custody), or (concretely) the sentry, the post; objectively preservation, or (concretely) safe; figuratively observance, i.e. (abstractly) duty or (objectively) a usage or party
to station, in various applications (literally or figuratively)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity

9.brief: the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a vehicle; by implication, a team; by extension, cavalry; by analogy a rider, i.e. the upper millstone
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
hence, an acre (i.e. day's task for a yoke of cattle to plough)
a steed (as stretched out to a vehicle, not single nor for mounting ); also (by implication) a driver (in a chariot), i.e. (collectively) cavalry
properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
Babel (i.e. Babylon), including Babylonia and the Babylonian empire
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

10.brief: a threshing, i.e. (concretely and figuratively) down-trodden people
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
a threshing-floor (as made even); by analogy, any open area
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise

11.brief: a burden; specifically, tribute, or (abstractly) porterage; figuratively, an utterance, chiefly adoom, especially singing; mental, desire
Dumah, a tribe and region of Arabia
near, with or among; often in general, to
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
Seir, a mountain of Idumaea and its aboriginal occupants, also one in Palestine
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity

12.brief: properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to gush over, i.e. to swell; (figuratively) to desire earnestly; by implication to ask
to gush over, i.e. to swell; (figuratively) to desire earnestly; by implication to ask
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

13.brief: a burden; specifically, tribute, or (abstractly) porterage; figuratively, an utterance, chiefly adoom, especially singing; mental, desire
Arab (i.e. Arabia), a country East of Palestine
a copse of bushes; hence, a forest; hence, honey in the comb (as hived in trees)
Arab (i.e. Arabia), a country East of Palestine
to stop (usually over night); by implication, to stay permanently; hence (in a bad sense) to be obstinate (especially in words, to complain)
Dedanites, the descendants or inhabitants of Dedan

14.brief: an encountering, accidental, friendly or hostile (also adverbially, opposite)
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
Tema, a son of Ishmael, and the region settled by him
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
to project (one self), i.e. precede; hence, to anticipate, hasten, meet (usually for help)
properly, to wave to and fro (rarely to flap up and down); figuratively, to rove, flee, or (causatively) to drive away

15.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement

a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris
to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)

a battle (i.e. the engagement); generally, war (i.e. warfare)

properly, like this, i.e. by implication, (of manner) thus (or so); also (of place) here (or hither); or (of time) now
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
a year (as a revolution of time)

a man at wages  by the day or year
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)

properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
Kedar, a son of Ishmael; also (collectively) Bedouin (as his descendants or representatives)

17.brief: a number, definite (arithmetical) or indefinite (large, innumerable; small, a few); also (abstractly) narration
a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
